Comments: I would like the option to upload tax exempt certificate and not be charged tax, instead of being charged tax and then refunded that amount I would like to be able to order on line with a purchase order and have the option to upload tax exempt certificate so that I won't be charged tax.

Make it more clear that though orders may be placed online, the availability of the item at the specified price depends on when tbr teacher submits order for class and not when you as the parent may submit. You have lost me as a customer.
I am overall satisfied with our interaction.  If I need to offer anything, it would be a faster response time.

The book I was looking to order for a student was not available for order online as a parent, but it was available as an educator. I would have ordered the book as an educator, but the shipping was $40 which I was not going to pay for 1 book.

Scholastic has too many divisions.  I understand that is how you need to keep things organized on your end, but on ours, it causes confusion to the point some will choose to use a different vendor.  I am the Purchasing Coordinator and tried to make it easy by talking with my reps and labeling each vendor by, club, fair, magazine, teacher resource and yet....this time, there was another entitiy that did not fit the criteria of the four I already had in the system.  You also have serveral different PO Boxes....however, I have been told that no matter where I send it, you will get it to the correct department.  Then why can we not just send the invoice to one PO Box?

I am a retired guy with excess personal means who is currently sponsoring teachers' classroom wish lists at two elementary schools. These are items which are outside of their allotted budgets. You are the ONLY site I've ever encountered which has stone-walled my attempts to buy classroom materials. Do you need the two schools in question to vouch for my donor history in order to allow me to direct purchase from the site that teachers and parents use? Being referred to your store.scholastic.com site is a worthless exercise since the titles requested by teachers have so far not generally been available on that site. I understand the discounts offered by the book publishers may have created contractual obligations for selling to schools or parents only. But surely, if I can be vouched for by Lowell Elementary School (Duluth, MN) and Northern Lights Elementary School (Superior, WI) - you ought to be able to allow me to create an account which I expect will generate in total a four figure sum in book orders over the indefinite span of time I intend to do this gifting. Can we figure out a way to make it easier for you to sell more books and still remain within the framework of whatever contracts you're obliged to honor ?  Thanks for any help - Geof Witrak, Duluth, MN  (218-428-7025)

With the first person to respond to my question/request I felt she just wanted to give me a hard time. She suggested things I can do to correct my error never touching on how she could help me on her end. Needs more customer training just a suggestion.   Five stars to the second person to respond to my question. It was more direct to the point that you can do something on your end. This kind of service is what us grandparents need. Thank you.

I made an error typing in my address that caused me to have to cancel my order and before I could reorder, I found the post office had corrected my address and delivered the package anyway,  I contacted customer service twice to pay for my order again but they said we didn’t need to and could just enjoy the books.  From a single mom just trying to provide Easter goodies for my kids, thank you so much!!
The representative was quick to respond and made for an easy transaction.
Nothing. It was fast and unexpected. Problem resolved. Communication prompt and great.
Solved the issue that you charged me a duplicate payment. Duplicate payment

If you could provide delivery information on the order instead of it showing in transit to the school would have been helpful. Since it had delivered 2 months ago. It's a he said she said issue with the school now.
I placed 2 orders and there is a third charge for $12.72 . I would like to know what that charge is for.
Have an unpaid invoice but never ordered anything

I don't understand, they have been sending me emails charging for some books that I bought for my daughter.  I have tried to contact the phone that they send, but I call and there is no one who speaks Spanish and they leave me waiting in line, I have tried to send them emails before and they send them back to me, they say that it cannot be sent, so that they explain to me that It happens, until today he is answering me, I tell them to pay for that purchase with my card, I don't know why they are charging me that I have not paid, they sent me the books, if they had not charged I think they would not have sent them, so I do not understand why They are charging me for something that I already paid for, what's more, I made another purchase, I still received the books because if I didn't pay, you wouldn't send the books.

I don't understand, they have been sending me emails charging for some books that I bought for my daughter.  I have tried to contact the phone that they send, but I call and there is no one who speaks Spanish and they leave me waiting in line, I have tried to send them emails before and they send them back to me, they say that it cannot be sent, so that they explain to me that It happens, until today he is answering me, I tell them to pay for that purchase with my card, I don't know why they are charging me that I have not paid, they sent me the books, if they had not charged I think they would not have sent them, so I do not understand why They are charging me for something that I already paid for, what's more, I made another purchase, I still received the books because if I didn't pay, you wouldn't send the books.
Speedy response to an issue I had with my order. It was handled quickly and efficiently!
Live chat would be very helpful
The promo codes I’ve been provided with are not working and I am not able to purchase the $5 and below book for my son.

Plenty! I received varied responses from 3 people. The problem stemmed your website. I ordered from the sale books.  It said Room on the Broom not available, we'll let you know when it's in stock. About 2 days later I received an email telling me it's in stock, order now before its gone.   I did. Then I received an email that it's not available. Hence 3 varied email responses from my complaint to Scholastic.  Then yesterdayil i received an email from the teacher that NONE OF THE BOOKS FROM THE SALE ARE AVAILABLE!!!  What a waste of my time,  shopping and then emailing for nothing!  So last night I tried ordering again.   But despite a new order totaling $26, the READS coupon would not respond to confirm and apply.   So I called a human this morning. I told her the problems, she placed the order with a terse voice, and only made one error (sending one book to the wrong school. I can handle that. ) Perhaps the problem stems from your tech department.  But I don't know why your people are not as friendly and efficient as they were 20 years ago when i was a "Scholastic Red Apple" teacher.  BTW, i try to order from each of my grandkids so their teachers can get points.   But the flimsy quality of the books is becoming a deterrent.  I spend more $ on tape to get more than one reading out of them. Good luck to you all, sanchezmln56@gmail.com

Please add a Q&A link for missing book.

I was charged an additional 505$ after my initial order of 491$ was processed and shipped. An additional *five hundred and five dollars* over what I agreed to purchase. The customer service person said that it was a pre-auth and it would fall off my bank account a day or so after the order shipped. A pre auth that hits after your first purchase goes through? For a different amount? That does not sound like a pre auth to me. It’s been a week and a half since the second charge went through and the customer service rep has not replied to my last email in a few days. Amazon, for all its flaws, would’ve had the problem sorted out in 30 minutes.

I am a retired teacher from Walthill Public Schools in Nebraska. I also am a grandparent of 14 grandchildren. I was told I could not order any Scholastic books. that book orders only are delivered to schools. That is sad that as a retired teacher, now on disability and grandmother of 14, along with the general public can't order books from your company. You let this type of business go to box stores and online stores.

I am a retired teacher from Walthill Public Schools in Nebraska. I also am a grandparent of 14 grandchildren. I was told I could not order any Scholastic books. that book orders only are delivered to schools. That is sad that as a retired teacher, now on disability and grandmother of 14, along with the general public can't order books from your company. You let this type of business go to box stores and online stores.
Great customer service!!! Very friendly and very helpful!
You guys were great at solving my problem.  It was my school district that was the issue.  My district was paying with a PO and took over a year to pay the bill.

1. If books were packaged so they do not slip over each other and get damaged during shipping and  that would be appreciated. 2. Received the replacement book today. It was in a HUGE box for one book! Very wasteful!

Preordered Dog Man books were delivered under another teacher's name. It took several days and an email to you to discover this. There were three different teacher's orders in the same box. Very confusing since all of us received emails saying the books were delivered.( It didn't help that we were on spring break the week prior to the delivery.)
Everything was great. I was very pleased with the help Joshua provided and getting things figured out!
It was very easy to get my problem resolved, thank you!

I need a catalog and I have over a dozen books that I do not know the reading level of the book.  That is not helpful to me with which the students that I teach remedial skills. Each book that you sell to us teachers should have the reading level on the cover -- somewhere.
The customer service agent was very prompt and very helpful, even though I wasn't confident that I would be able to get resolution. I appreciate your dedication to helping teachings!

I live chatted today as I had forgotten how to enter my $10 book choices.  The Chat person or bot could not tell me how, and then told me I didn't earn enough point for free books in March.  I finally figured our that the code was on a postcard from my last book order. It would be nice if it were made clearer.

The chat function kept crashing. I had to restart a few times. This is nothing with the customer services, but the wording to banking the reward points. The rewards points cannot be banked each month unless someone is making a purchase. It's misleading.

A purchase order for one of my teachers had been mailed to Scholastic.  When we inquired about it, Scholastic had no record of our order.  I scanned and emailed the order.  Then I was told that the teacher needed to create her own account and I needed to split our P.O. because we couldn't get more than 75 of the book we wanted on one order.  This order was time sensitive to begin with and this was more trouble than it was worth.  We cancelled our P.O.

A purchase order for one of my teachers had been mailed to Scholastic.  When we inquired about it, Scholastic had no record of our order.  I scanned and emailed the order.  Then I was told that the teacher needed to create her own account and I needed to split our P.O. because we couldn't get more than 75 of the book we wanted on one order.  This order was time sensitive to begin with and this was more trouble than it was worth.  We cancelled our P.O.
We didn't receive two books. The representative asked me for the titles and said they would be here in  a few days.

The first person I spoke to disconnected our chat when I asked a question that contradicted what she said. I was very frustrated and felt she was not understanding my confusion. The last person I talked to was FANTASTIC. She understood my frustration and explained the situation to me.

Customer service representative that I spoke to on the phone was great and very helpful.  The online chat was not helpful and told me she was unable to assist me with changing the delivery that seemed to be easily done by the phone representative.
I sent two emails with questions and have not heard back from you on eather of them.

I was looking for the dollar packs of books in Spanish. The representative sent me to more expensive groups of books in Spanish. This is not equitable. There are lots of bilingual schools and bilingual students who would benefit from more books at school and home.
My order was missing a book, but quick live chat and problem solved, book is supposed to be mail out soon. waiting on book to be shipped out haven't gotten email conformation yet

If I had received my Apple Rewards monthly promo code as I usually do, I would not have needed to call. At the time I did not realize I also did not receive the $10 in free books to choose in April. My March order confirmation email states I earned the 300 points and the $10 but I did not receive them. The representative quickly gave me a promo code for the points but I did not realize I needed to also ask for the $10.

I do not understand why the charge for shipping has been changed without notifying teachers. It used to be that when you were an apple teacher you received free shipping. I was never notified that that changed. It also use to be when you had an online order your entire order shipped free. I was not notified about that change either. If you are going to make changes, you should notify your teachers. I am afraid to send flyers home now for fear that I will not get $25.00 or more and I will have to pay $6.50. I guess I will no longer send flyers home because of the shipping charge that is charged to me. Why don't you just raise the price of the books a little bit to cover the cost to ship them?
Thank you for the quick response and quick fix :)

I could not finish my live chat.  I had to get my students.  I am not sure if I will be receiving 8 more books.  I believe I ordered 20 of There Was An Old Woman Who Swallowed A Birthday Cake.  I only received 12.

In the 15 minutes I attempted to connect with an agent, I was disconnected twice. I was trying to seek help with an order placed 3/9. It still has not arrived. Tracking keeps pushing the date back. I was hoping to find out why so I could inform my families.
I am looking for $1 books but could not find any.

I had one single sheet of free stickers sent in its own big box with a packing slip.  I find this to be irresponsible and wasteful.  The book that was meant to accompany the stickers was sent about a week later.  Again, this is irresponsible and wasteful.
Consider what I said….prices for teachers to buy class sets of books or gift books are too high.
Clearly informed me of at hoe orders.

I wanted to get the replacement books sent out quickly and I was told I would have to pay $25 expedited I have tried to order books that you have run out of stock on. It is disappointing for the students when I can't order what they want.
An item that a student ordered is now out of stock.  Their check was already mailed.  Now, even if the item comes back in stock, I will have to pay shipping to get it.
An item that a student ordered is now out of stock.  Their check was already mailed.  Now, even if the item comes back in stock, I will have to pay shipping to get it.
Everyone with customer service is always pleasant and helpful.

Please try to add more variety to your grade level boxes.  I buy them as gift books and they always have books that are not suitable for gifting in them.  It has been the same variety for the past few years.  You send out multiple copies of throwaway books instead of books students would like.

Fix the problem Trying to place a book order for my class and I am able to do everything online until I get to the submit your order part… It does not let me submit my order… I tried on three different devices.
I appreciate the ability to ask questions and be answered through the chat function. It makes everything easier. Thank you.

Somehow my order was inadvertently altered. I order 2 "Tacos Are for Dragons"-- one in English, one in Spanish, but received 2 in Spanish. The response from your Scholastic rep hardly addressed my concern and said to order the English version. Thanks for the teacher support 😳.

Somehow my order was inadvertently altered. I order 2 "Tacos Are for Dragons"-- one in English, one in Spanish, but received 2 in Spanish. The response from your Scholastic rep hardly addressed my concern and said to order the English version. Thanks for the teacher support 😳.
The customer service agent was easy to work with !

I do not know if this has been resolved yet! You keep sending this survey before resolution! You recently contacted me because I contracted you that an order had been placed under my teacher account by a student named Logan. I do not have a Logan. I reached out to you to tell you so that YOU could resolve this on YOUR end. However, you have since asked me to forward you the information from the original email and that's where everything has been left at. I am almost sorry that I even brought it up.
Your representative understood my questions clearly, answered quickly and I was able to submit my order.  Thank you for your help.

I am going to place a book order on March 28, 2023, but I no longer had my account credit available. I sent in a check for $176 on Sept. 25, 2022. I was withdrawal from my bank account on Oct. 5, 2022. I only have spend $64.08 of my account credit during this school year, so should have $111.92 of account credit.
I called twice before speaking to a representative due to wait times for help.

Box orders as individual teachers orders or put in mailers separately in a box if shipping multiple orders together.  So orders can be easily separated. Hard cover books shipped together in large boxes are damaging the other books
My problem was solved quickly and efficiently. I’m very satisfied with the customer service.
Nothing Customer service, whether by email or chat, always answers questions quickly and is helpful and friendly. My dissatisfaction is with the current “some rewards now and some next month” system.

I found out that the book my student had ordered was a pre-order. When it arrived, it was a little strange because it was in a box for another teacher from my school. Thankfully,  that teacher figured out it was for my class.
I was having trouble with website and unable to complete my order.

I had two questions, my first question was resolved. The second question was about the substitution stickers. I still don't understand why it said 2+ behind each one when there was not enough to give each kid 2. I also didn't understand why one kid that didn't order was listed to get stickers and stickers only. I also didn't understand why I had Pokemon and Dogman stickers.
I used the message system on the scholastic website. It was quick and easy and got my question answered.
The representative I spoe to was very friendly and helpful.
Everything was great.  The representative helped me to access my online student orders.  Thank you!

You told me how to track the package and that there would be a way to contact them if it was not delivered in time for spring break.  I did not have to use it because it was delivered on time. I would have liked a way to contact you BEFORE that as I was panicking. However, maybe that is not the best way to deal with it on your end.
The service agent was super nice and helpful.
Helped me delay delivery of a shipment since our school will be closed for break
I sent an email about the item being replaced. I haven't heard back since.

Initially, I contacted customer service by phone to check in on an order for the new Dog Man book. The individual I spoke with informed me that the cut off date to order the book and receive it on the release date was March 20th. Then she noted that my student had placed the order online on March 20th, but that the book order was not processed until the release date of March 28th. That didn't really make sense to me if he ordered within the deadline, but she couldn't provide any other answers. So I used the Live Chat online and they told me that the cut off date for ordering was actually March 19th. So my student had missed the cut off date, which would explain way he hadn't received the book yet. Not a big deal, we were happy to figure out why the book hadn't arrived yet.

I submit my March book order.  A couple of days later and another order came in.  I put in the order it was 21, 4 dollars short of free shipping.  I asked the online help "Cindy" if she could waive the shipping charge since really my order for March is over the 25 mark.  If both orders were added together it would have been 50 or more dollars spent.  At first, Cindy said no.  Then she decided to make an let me have the free shipping.  She didn't ask me if I had a teacher order and didn't include that in my new order.  She was very rude.  She finally let it go through.  I didn't even try and get the rewards I miss out on, because she was so hard to work with.  It makes me what to stop offering scholastic books to my families because ordering is such a pain.

I submit my March book order.  A couple of days later and another order came in.  I put in the order it was 21, 4 dollars short of free shipping. Very Satisfied! A book my student received was damaged. Thank you for making it right for him! It was satisfying to tell him that a new book is on the way.

Thank you for having the online chat available.  It was a a quick way to solve a problem -- and I was very happy with the speed in which it was taken care of.  Thanks again.  I have done business with you for 40 years, and have always been happy!

I have yet to try getting to the TAB flyer based on the instructions, but I will follow the guideline and hope it works.  Thank you.  The web site is not always easy to follow and I end up going in circles...
The customer service rep was very helpful and she handled my issue very quickly.  I appreciate that so much!
I just had a few books missing. The representative asked which ones and the whole call took less than 3 minutes. Thank you!

Allow books to be purchased outside of a pack I buy a book for my students every year that they love. I buy they curious you, on your way. This book symbolizes how proud I am of my students and how their possibilities in life are endless. This year, the book comes in a pack and I am unable to purchase it separately. I contacted a representative about buying it separately and was told no. I am very upset and disappointed as I spend a lot of money with this company. This book is very meaningful to me and my classroom. This book had become a tradition for five years now that I would like to continue.

I am sure tht the rep was doing everything they could with the information that they were presented. The issue stemmed from a shipping error. I was told that the order was being sent in my name. It was not. It came addressed to another teacher here at the building.
They were able to solve it quickly and my email came with the correction faST.

The representative solved it very effectively.  The fact that I needed to remember to go back in to contact Scholastic to remove tax each time I place an order is frustrating.  This particular order was broken in two and the second was delayed because it was a new book release date (Dog Man ...Thousand Fleas).  I just ordered another order and will need to remember to ask after it is shipped.  I just think there could be a more effective way on your end to handle this without asking the teachers to remember.
I find it ridiculous that I had to pay $7.12 to have two gift cards sent to me.  It shouldn't cost more than a letter.
Quick and easy through chat. Was able to get damaged books replaced :)

I emailed someone after the chat so hopefully it will be looked at.  The person answering did not know the answer and did nothing to try to find the answer.  I do not mind people not knowing but to make me do all the work to find the answer , as a customer, is not right.
Purchase Orders are consistently lost and not processed, has been a problem for the past 2 years

I was trying to place a book order for one of our teachers for 80 books and although I did get back prompt email responses, it never resolved the issue of being able to purchase these books with using our tax exemption as we are a school.  It was very difficult to navigate the Scholastic website and the representative answering my emails kept mentioning a Scholastic Dollars Catalog from which I was never able to find the book I was needing to buy.  We have since gone ahead and found the book elsewhere to purchase.  I appreciate the email help, but it didn't resolve the problem and it was not easy to navigate anywhere on the Scholastic sites.  Also, once approved for tax exemption you should be able to just purchase off of Scholastic.com and have the exemption show up.  Thanks so much!

This particular experience was fine.  However, the reason for contacting Scholastic seems to become an ongoing issue.  Tax has been included recently and you didn't have our exemption certificate on file even though we've been a customer for a long time.  We've had problems not receiving invoices as well as teachers being emailed multiple times about overdue payments that had actually been made in a very timely manner.  Most recently, we had to send a copy of our cancelled check to prove it had been paid.  It just seems to be an ongoing issue.
A book I ordered months ago was claimed to have been out of stock, even though I ordered it months in advance.
Customer service was great. I received a prompt response back.
I would have liked to have the option to change my payment source or cancel my order since it hadn’t gone out and the card hadn’t been charged yet.
I sent an email to ask if you would be sending paper flyers or if I needed to print them out myself.  I never received a response.
I sent an email to ask if you would be sending paper flyers or if I needed to print them out myself.  I never received a response.
I think it was handled very well.
I placed a order March 2, paid with my debit card 53.00 I have still not received my order.  I am a teacher not parent.  I always order online and ship to school.

Book boxes should not be mailed through anything that will be delivered after school hours.  Usually my boxes are sent through the mail and arrive during business hours.  We are open until 3pm like a normal school.  This last time they were sent UPS and kept trying to get delivered after hours.  Boxes can't be left without someone to collect, so my box kept getting sent back.  Please be sure to tell the carrier picking up that they need to be delivered during regular school day hours. Or only send them through regular postal service mail.

The representative was very nice but was as confused as I was that I received an email saying that my order had been canceled. According to her computer, the order was getting ready to ship. Clearly, it's not her fault but I'm still confused about why I received such an email???

We are cancelling all our orders with you both the business tech and I have had a single phone contact with your ordering department. We sent our Purchase orders to two separate emails on several occasions. our orders were sent in early February and we are just getting some attention. We don't have time for this back and forth email from non people. We are ordering from Barnes and Noble. We have parents who were excited about the book club but this is a mess.

We are cancelling all our orders with you both the business tech and I have had a single phone contact with your ordering department. We sent our Purchase orders to two separate emails on several occasions. our orders were sent in early February and we are just getting some attention. We don't have time for this back and forth email from non people. We are ordering from Barnes and Noble. We have parents who were excited about the book club but this is a mess.

The representative would NOT listen to my concern.  I was calling to correct an error that I made when ordering on our school account.  Instead of listening and helping to solve the problem, he choose to YELL at me.  I was a public school teacher for 30 years, so I am well aware of how the Scholastic book ordering system works for teachers and the benefits the teachers receive.  I did not need to receive a lecture about how I could not order books unless the school was paying for them. I was ordering the books and paying for them myself as the end of the year gifts for my children.   I work for a small church school and we are ordering as a school, not individual teachers.  Fortunately, our director, Ms. Andi Stakes was able to call and get a very nice person that helped her to find a solution to my mistake.  Thanks to the help she received, I was able to get the books that I needed.
The person from Scholastic was very helpful!! I appreciated the quick resolution to the problem.
I if changes need to be made to order please include a note explaining the change
The checkout experience could be a bit more user-friendly.

Technically your site is disappointing. I am making a large purchase. I am purchasing for about 100 students. I am wanting to put them in by name so that when they come in they can be handed out by name. I will also be purchasing some books myself. If I get kicked out of your site then it drops the students that are put in on the flyers. This should be easier then this- for any one a big order or small. Be more customer friendly! Thanks

As a red Apple teacher I was told I didn't have to pay shipping for an order.  When i placed my order, in which I used my bonus points, I had to pay over $7 in shipping costs.  I asked this question in the chat are and in fact, it seems that there was no exception.  The response was clear and the person was polite.  I'm just not happy with the fact that i had to pay for shipping out of my pocket.  I still placed the order and then I received an email saying my order was canceled, I was very confused. Now I don't know if my order is getting fulfilled or not.

As a red Apple teacher I was told I didn't have to pay shipping for an order.  When i placed my order, in which I used my bonus points, I had to pay over $7 in shipping costs.  I asked this question in the chat are and in fact, it seems that there was no exception.  The response was clear and the person was polite.  I'm just not happy with the fact that i had to pay for shipping out of my pocket.  I still placed the order and then I received an email saying my order was canceled, I was very confused. Now I don't know if my order is getting fulfilled or not.

I received a hardback book that had the cover and pages warped upwards.  I emailed Scholastic and was sent a new book with no issue.  When I received the new book, it also was warped but not as badly as the original book I received.
One of my students didn't get part of her order. I couldn't wait any longer to talk with someone; so I had to hang up.
One of my students didn't get part of her order. I couldn't wait any longer to talk with someone; so I had to hang up.
The representative gave me the information to secure a quote, I'm just waiting for the quote to be issued.
I was trying to see if I could get a new catalog or see if there was an online version of the catalog so that I may order books for my school.

I understand that those working in the customer service department have many people they are chatting with at a time.  That said, it would have been nice to have been greeted by a non-automated message before beginning with my issue with the representative.
Please advise your shippers (ie UPS), NOT to delivery on Sundays.  Apparently, my order was delivered somewhere on a Sunday.  It did, eventually, find it's way to me.
I need a refund I sent varies if emails
I need a refund I sent varies if emails
I love Scholastic and my students' excitement when they get their books!

I paid for 2 day shipping, order placed on a Sunday - I understand business days; therefore, it was my impression that by at least Wednesday order would arrive. By Thursday still no order and I was told 1 day for processing, 2 days in warehouse and then shipped. That is not 2 day shipping. UPS driver then arrived after school closed so drove away on first delivery attempt, 2nd attempt same thing, came after school closed.  I just wasted $25 on an order that was needed last week as part was for a birthday present.
The live chat button is great. I get great help and support through that option.
My question was answered quickly, and I was able to solve the problem.
A parent ordered a book on line that never arrived and it appeared on the invoice but I am being told that the book doesn't exist.
Perhaps a faster turn around on my request. I ordered a Target gift card with my teacher points and it never arrived.  It would be great if you could send it electronically to avoid this.
I have not received my bonus points for getting a friend to join scholastic book club.  Her name is Diana Peterson. Thank you, Kelly Holm

I am not a fan of live chat usually. Your rep replied quickly and went straight to my question unlike other experiences I have had with other companies. Thank you for respecting my time. With the directions I was given I emailed information to get a quote so I could get a PO, again the process was quickly addressed. I appreciate this kind of customer service.
Just waiting to reply back to your rep.

My students and I ordered items that includes Pokémon stickers for free if ordered 3/31/2023…however, without letting us know, just replaced with Dogman bookmarks and stickers upon receiving the items. Although you replaced with other item, you should have emailed me and informed that you ran out of the Pokémon stickers(12). Because of disappointments from students. I’ve requested if  a Pokémon book to be sent instead, the representative said no b/c of the Dogman stickers. We are very disappointed with this experience.
I just needed a printable receipt for school!

I am an early childhood teacher who teaches 3-5 year old children, most of whom, have special needs.  I have a few students on  a kindergarten level, so I asked for and receive kindergarten book club flyers. The problem is that your system seems to consider me a kindergarten class.  My class link goes to kindergarten flyers online, not early childhood.  I receive kindergarten/elementary stickers like Pokeman, not Peppa Pig stickers for early childhood.  My Scholastic profile includes preschool/early childhood, preK, and kindergarten, but I am primarily an early childhood teacher.  How can I change my profile to reflect that while still receiving kindergarten material for my above-level students? This survey assumes that my situation was resolved.  I did get help adding bonus points to my account, because I checked out without entering my code.  That was resolved with my first email, and I very much appreciate that.  The issue of my class link defaulting to kindergarten flyer pages is not resolved.  I only have a few students on the kindergarten level.  The rest are at or below the preschool level.
Customer service is fantastic! I was missing a book a student ordered, and was sent a pack of books by mistake. They said to keep the extra books for my classroom and sent the missing book quickly.

Acknowledge that their was a possibility that students who ordered in March were not going to receive the promotion Peppa Pig stickers. I appreciate Scholastic giving teachers the opportunity to make suggestions and voice concerns for our students.  Thank you!
It may be something to consider: scholarships for title, one schools families. Book orders have gone down significantly when they have to choose between food and books.
I want to share my wishlist with parents. I didn’t understand what the CS rep was telling me to do. Very vague and incomplete directions were given.

I had a parent order two items. Within a few days, one item was still showing up on your site, but was emailed to me that it was out of stock. I personally bought the student books to make up for it, and submitted my order.   Then I received an email that the other item was out of stock.  On my email, it showed both items as being part of the order and shipping with the box.  Neither item came, just the items I personally bought to make it right with the family.  The rep just told me to have the family shop elsewhere. Which I find disgusting that you’d rather send your customers elsewhere than do something to make it right.

I had a parent order two items. Within a few days, one item was still showing up on your site, but was emailed to me that it was out of stock. I personally bought the student books to make up for it, and submitted my order.   Then I received an email that the other item was out of stock.  On my email, it showed both items as being part of the order and shipping with the box.  Neither item came, just the items I personally bought to make it right with the family.  The rep just told me to have the family shop elsewhere. Which I find disgusting that you’d rather send your customers elsewhere than do something to make it right.

There was an issue with no packing slip in the order. Someone had opened the box with my name on it and didn't see a packing slip. Something they should not have done anyway, but it caused issues with which of my students got which order and also confusion because one book was being shipped later. Thank you for helping me figure it out.
Nothing I did not get a resolution to my issue but it was not scholastic's fault.  I was just hoping they kept a copy of an order form.

I tried to make a phone call to have the order changed for the parent that ordered online but the phone number is not readily availabale.  I did a live chat in the afternoon to try and resolve the problem but I was told that the order was in the process of being filled so changes could not happen.  I was told that the parent can return the item at their cost and get a refund or exchange it for a different item.  The problem with this is parents are not going to want to order if problems can't be fixed before the order is completed or shipped.  I was not pleased with how difficult it was to deal with you in a timely manner.  If things go well they are great but not so much when there is a problem.
Swift service and taken care of with the first email.
Help with being able to transfer an order easier
Thank you for being so helpful!
Should be an easier way to have tax removed automatically from our order if we are a school.

I had just submitted an order and requested to swap one book of equal price with another, as I had accidently added two of the same book to my order. The representative was unable to assist me with this. Seems to me to be a simple request.
Chat feature worked smoothly and efficiently. Joy was helpful and resourceful. I am glad that she is sending a new product to account for the missing product in my order.
I actually have chatted with a few of your reps and all were knowledgeable and helpful with quick responses ---all of which was very appreciated.

I have 2 interactions on the same day - First with Kristen via chat and she was AWFUL.  Second was with Julie via phone that she was WONDERUL.  Kristen was NOT helpful and did not listen to my problem!  I even downloaded the transcript because it was THAT BAD.  Julie then fixed it all and was MORE than helpful!  A true Gem!

My issue involved getting our tax number applied to our order.  It would be very beneficial if this could be done at the point of the initial order.  There are different people in different departments that have to be involved in the current method and it could be a quicker easier process.
Would be nice not to have to ask for invoice with taxes taken off for every order.  I am ordering for our Library.
